title: Productive matrix
summary: In linear algebra, a square nonnegative matrix A {\displaystyle A} of order n {\displaystyle n} is said to be productive, or to be a Leontief matrix, if there exists a n × 1 {\displaystyle n\times 1} nonnegative column matrix P {\displaystyle P} such as P − A P {\displaystyle P-AP} is a positive matrix.
